channel.title: Decentralizing Capitalism
channel.description: An ambitious community-driven show inspired by the reshaping our capital markets, monetary system, and labor organization. Driven by the ethos of decentralizing knowledge, founder John Wooten aims to make investments as accessible and open to everyone as information and money are through TCP/IP and blockchain. You can join our mission of empowering the next generation by adding your own episode through a PR on this show's GitHub page. Tune in to learn how you can be part of this revolutionary movement towards a decentralized economy.

item.title: John Wooten et al: How Should We Govern the Financial System? | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: In this episode, we examine the emergence of new banking structures and the foundational role governance plays in their success. We highlight the launch of the first American DUNA (nonprofit DAO) organization, a pioneering effort to redefine financial networks through transparent, decentralized systems. From the challenges of aligning stakeholders to the critical importance of system governance, we explore how these innovative structures are reshaping the financial landscape and creating new opportunities for inclusivity and accountability.

item.title: John Wooten: Global Moves to Curtail U.S. Investor Protections | Ankit Sehgal
item.description: In this episode, we explore how Singapore, Switzerland, and China are leveraging tokenized treasuries and blockchain innovations to sidestep traditional U.S. investor protection laws. Using UBS's upcoming tokenized treasuries as a case study, we analyze the global shift in financial strategies and what it means for American investors.

item.description: In this episode, we discuss the inspiration of this show.
